intro: Bernardia amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian balsa tree, is a tropical plant native to the rainforests of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous small, winged seeds. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland and montane forest regions. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
